00055 SocketEngine::SocketEngine(     const std::string &program, 
00056                                 const std::string &jobFile, 
00057                                 const std::string &host, 
00058                                 unsigned int port) :
00059     m_Program(program), m_Host(host), m_Port(port) {
00060     m_PgOpts.push_back(m_Program);
00061     m_PgOpts.push_back("--xml-file");
00062     m_PgOpts.push_back(jobFile);    
00063     initVars();
00064 }
00065 
00066 SocketEngine::SocketEngine(     const std::string &program, 
00067                                 const std::vector<std::string> &args, 
00068                                 const std::string &host, 
00069                                 unsigned int port) :
00070     m_Program(program),  m_Host(host), m_Port(port) {
00071     m_PgOpts.resize(args.size() + 1);
00072     m_PgOpts[0] = m_Program;
00073     copy(args.begin(), args.end(), m_PgOpts.begin() + 1);
00074     initVars();
00075 }

00080 bool SocketEngine::run() {    
00081     // Our handler that will fire the appropriate verbose and progress calls locally
00082     SocketTextHandler handler;
00083     server.addHandler(&handler);
00084         
00085     unsigned int portUsed = server.socketOpen(m_Host, m_Port);
00086     if (portUsed == 0) 
00087     {
00088         Verbose::out(1,"Unable to establish a socket connection.  This run will abort");
00089         return false;
00090     }
00091     m_Port = portUsed;  
00092     string port = ToStr(m_Port);
00093     char host_port_buf[100];
00094     snprintf(host_port_buf,sizeof(host_port_buf), "%s:%s", m_Host.c_str(),port.c_str());
00095 
00096     m_PgOpts.push_back("--console-off");
00097     m_PgOpts.push_back("true");
00098     m_PgOpts.push_back("--use-socket");
00099     m_PgOpts.push_back(host_port_buf);
00100     #ifdef _WIN32
00101     doWindows(server, handler, m_Host, port, m_PgOpts);
00102     #else
00103     doUnix(server, handler, m_Host, port, m_PgOpts);
00104     #endif
00105     return handler.successfulRun();
00106 }

00109 int SocketEngine::doWindows(    SocketServer &server, 
00110                                 SocketTextHandler &handler, 
00111                                 string &host, string &port,
00112                                 vector<string> commandArgs) {
00113     #ifdef _WIN32 
00114  
00115     string command;
00116 
00117     for (size_t i = 0; i < commandArgs.size(); i++) 
00118     {
00119         command = command + "\"" + commandArgs[i] + "\" ";
00120     }
00121     Verbose::out(1,"Command is: " + command);
00122     ws = new TCHAR[command.size()+1];
00123     try 
00124     {
00125         int i=0;
00126         for( std::string::const_iterator it = command.begin(); it != command.end(); it++ ) 
00127         {
00128             //  Verbose::out(1, "Doing character: " + ToStr(i) + " of " + ToStr(command.length()));
00129             ws[i++] = use_facet< ctype<wchar_t> >(cout.getloc()).widen( *it);
00130         }
00131         ws[command.size() - 1 ] = NULL;
00132         Verbose::out(1, "Done doing ws");
00133 
00134     if(!CreateProcess( m_lpApplicationName, 
00135                        ws,
00136                        m_lpProcessAttributes, 
00137                        m_lpThreadAttributes,
00138                        m_bInheritHandles,
00139                        m_dwCreationFlags,
00140                        m_lpEnvironment,
00141                        m_lpCurrentDirectory,
00142                        &m_StartInfo,
00143                        &m_ProcInfo)) 
00144     {
00145         Err::errAbort("Could not run the program.");
00146     }
00147     Verbose::out(1,"Waiting for connections.");
00148     while(1) 
00149     { 
00150         std::vector<std::string> messages;
00151         bool connected = false;
00152         bool beenConnected = false;
00153          
00154         int numFound = server.acceptNewConnection();
00155         if (numFound > 0) 
00156         {
00157             Verbose::out(1, "Found connections.");     
00158         }
00159         DWORD exitVal;
00160         bool rv = GetExitCodeProcess(m_ProcInfo.hProcess, &exitVal);
00161 
00162         if (exitVal != STILL_ACTIVE) 
00163         {
00164             if (exitVal == 0) 
00165             {
00166                 break;
00167             }
00168             else 
00169             {
00170                 Err::errAbort("Process failed with code: " + ToStr(rv));
00171             }
00172         }
00173         if (server.isConnected()) 
00174         {
00175             beenConnected = true;
00176             connected = true;
00177             bool stillConnected = server.processNewMessages();
00178                 
00179             if (!stillConnected) 
00180             {
00181                 Verbose::out(1,"Lost connection...");
00182                 break;
00183             }
00184         }
00185         if (!server.isConnected()) 
00186         {
00187             Verbose::out(1,".", false);
00188         }
00189         Sleep(500);
00190     }
00191   }
00192   catch (...) {
00193    TerminateProcess(m_ProcInfo.hProcess,0); 
00194    delete []ws;
00195    server.cleanUp(); 
00196    throw;
00197   }
00198   delete []ws;
00199 #endif
00200   return 0;
00201 }

00204 void SocketEngine::TerminateLaunchedApp()
00205 {
00206 #ifdef _WIN32
00207         try
00208         {
00209                 DWORD exitVal;
00210                 int counter = 0;
00211                 delete []ws;
00212                 bool rv = GetExitCodeProcess(m_ProcInfo.hProcess, &exitVal);    
00213                 if (exitVal == STILL_ACTIVE)
00214                         TerminateProcess(m_ProcInfo.hProcess,0);   
00215         }
00216         catch(...)
00217         {
00218         }
00219 #endif
00220  server.cleanUp();
00221 }

00223 int SocketEngine::doUnix(       SocketServer &server, 
00224                                 SocketTextHandler &handler, 
00225                                 string &host, string &port,
00226                                 vector<string> commandArgs) {
00227     #ifndef _WIN32
00228     int pid = fork();
00229     cout << "host " << host << " port " << port;
00230     if(pid > 0) 
00231     {
00232         try 
00233         {
00234             //server.socketOpen(host, port);
00235             // sleep(2);
00236             std::vector<std::string> messages;
00237             bool connected = false;
00238             bool beenConnected = false;
00239             while(1) 
00240             {
00241                 int numFound = server.acceptNewConnection();
00242                 if (numFound > 0) 
00243                 {
00244                     cout << "Found " << numFound << " new connections." << endl;
00245                 }
00246                 if (server.isConnected()) 
00247                 {
00248                     beenConnected = true;
00249                     connected = true;
00250                     bool stillConnected = server.processNewMessages();
00251                     if (!stillConnected) 
00252                     {
00253                         cout << "Lost connection..." << endl;
00254                         break;
00255                     }
00256                 }
00257                 if (!server.isConnected()) 
00258                 {
00259                     cout << ".";
00260                     cout.flush();
00261                 }
00262                 struct timespec tWait, tRet;
00263                 tWait.tv_sec = 0;
00264                 tWait.tv_nsec = 100000000;
00265                 //        nanosleep(1);
00266                 nanosleep(&tWait, &tRet);
00267             }
00268         }
00269         catch (...) 
00270         {
00271             cout << "Caught exception. Killing child process: " << pid << endl;
00272             int rv = kill(pid, 15);
00273             // if termination signal doesn't work then hard kill...
00274             if (rv != 0) 
00275             {
00276             rv = kill(pid, 9);
00277             }
00278         } // end catch 
00279     } // end if
00280     else if (pid == 0) 
00281     {
00282         vector<const char*> execvp_args;
00283         // @todo this should be some sort of util function.
00284         for (int i=0;i<commandArgs.size();i++) 
00285         {
00286             execvp_args.push_back(commandArgs[i].c_str());
00287         }
00288         execvp_args.push_back(NULL);
00289         char * const* tmp=(char * const*)&execvp_args[0];
00290         //
00291         cout << "Launching process..." << endl;
00292         int rv = execvp(tmp[0], tmp);
00293         cout << "command: " << commandArgs[0];
00294         for (int i = 1; i < commandArgs.size(); i++) 
00295         {
00296             cout << " " << commandArgs[i];
00297         }
00298         cout << endl;
00299         cout << "Error - Return val: " << rv << endl;
00300     }
00301     else 
00302     {
00303         cout << "Bad pid." << endl;
00304         return 1;
00305     }
00306 #endif
00307     return 0;
00308 }

00310 #ifdef _WIN32
00311 void SocketEngine::initVars() {
00312     Verbose::out(1, "Initializing variables.");
00313     memset(&m_StartInfo,0,sizeof(m_StartInfo));
00314     m_StartInfo.cb= sizeof(m_StartInfo);
00315     memset(&m_ProcInfo,0,sizeof(m_ProcInfo));
00316     m_lpApplicationName = NULL;
00317     m_lpProcessAttributes = NULL;
00318     m_lpThreadAttributes = NULL;
00319     m_bInheritHandles = false;
00320     m_dwCreationFlags = CREATE_NO_WINDOW;
00321     m_lpEnvironment = NULL;
00322     m_lpCurrentDirectory = NULL;
00323 
00324 }
00325 #endif  /*WIN32 */
